ud2.3:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud2.3:1.3: Now at that time, between Sāvatthī and the Jeta Grove, several boys were hitting a snake with a stick.
ud2.3:1.4: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
ud2.3:1.5: He saw the boys hitting the snake.
ud2.3:2.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud2.3:3.2: so if you hurt them with a stick
ud2.3:3.3: in search of your own happiness,
ud2.3:3.4: after death you’ll find no happiness.
ud2.3:4.2: so if you don’t hurt them with a stick
ud2.3:4.3: in search of your own happiness,
ud2.3:4.4: after death you will find happiness.”
